intro: Holoschoenus vulgaris subsp. panormitanus, commonly known as the Mediterranean grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features slender, grass-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color and grow in dense clumps. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny flowers, which are usually pale blue or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and rocky slopes. This subspecies is adapted to Mediterranean climates, tolerating drought and salt spray.
